clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Serelaxin Versus Standard of Care in Acute Heart Failure (AHF) Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Prospective, Randomized, Open-label Study to Assess the Effect of Serelaxin Versus Standard of Care in Acute Heart Failure (AHF) Patients

brief_summary.textblock: This is a multinational, multicenter, randomized, open-label study to confirm and expand the efficacy, safety and tolerability evidence of 48 hours intravenous infusion of serelaxin (30 micrograms/kg/day) when added to Standard of Care (SoC) in patients admitted to hospital for Acute Heart Failure (AHF).

detailed_description.textblock: This study is aimed at generating clinical evidence, especially on the short term period (in-hospital and at 30 days) that will complement existing and future serelaxin data sets in Acute Heart Failure (AHF).

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in worsening HF (WHF) requiring rescue therapy or all cause death, through Day 5

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in worsening HF (WHF) requiring rescue therapy or all cause death or readmission for heart failure and or renal failure through day 14
Change from baseline in the number of patients with persistent symptoms or signs of Heart Failure (HF) or not showing improvement (persisting need of Intravenous therapy for HF)
Change from baseline in the rate of renal deterioration at day 5
secondary_outcome.description: Renal deterioration is defined as > or = 0.3 mg/dL increase in serum creatinine.
Length of stay (in hours) will be defined as the index discharge date and time minus the index hospitalization start date and time.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients reported with adverse events as assessment of safety and tolerability of Serelaxin in AHF patients
Change from baseline in Health-related quality of life, assessed by EuroQoL EQ-5D questionnaire

clinical_study.condition: Systolic Blood Pressure > or = 125 mm Hg,

arm_group.description: Serelaxin (30 µg/kg/day) as continuous 48 hour intravenous infusion plus standard of care.

All patients will be required to receive standard of care background heart failure (HF) management during the study, according to local guidelines/international standards. This treatment can include but is not limited to intravenous and/or oral diuretics, angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) inhibitors/angiotensin receptor antagonists, blockers and aldosterone receptor antagonists, etc.

intervention.description: This treatment can include but is not limited to intravenous and/or oral diuretics, angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) inhibitors/angiotensin receptor antagonists, blockers and aldosterone receptor antagonists, etc.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Systolic blood pressure > 125 mmHg
- Admitted for Acute Heart Failure (AHF)
- Furosemide at any time between admission and the start of screening
- eGFR on admission: ≥30 and ≤75 mL/min/1.73 m2
Exclusion Criteria:
- Dyspnea (non-cardiac causes)
- T >38.5°C
- Clinical evidence of acute coronary syndrome
- AHF due to arrhythmias, acute myocarditis or cardiomyopathy
Other protocol defined inclusion/exclusion criteria may apply
